column2: Animal Health and Veterinary Laboratories Agency (AHVLA)
Center for Environment, Fisheries & Aquaculture Science (Cefas)
column4: SEO posts are a range of scientific specialists  required to fulfil programme delivery requirements

column3: Business Critical Vacancies and Frontline Vacancies

column23: These two levy bodies cannot provide a grade breakdown as they do not use Civil Service equivalent grading.
total colums include approvals for which no grade breakdown is available

column2: The frontine and business critical roles are required for delivery of our corporate objectives including but not limited to flood risk management and flood management technical resilience, processing of environmental permits, river water quality improvements, and regulatory responsibilities such as waste management.

RPA have been given approval for up to 100 FTE to cover us through the CAP implementation period. As yet we have only taken in a small number of people under that approval. Therefore further grades, length of service etc are still to be determined. We are therefore unable to be specific about salary and expenditure.This reflects our flexible/agile approach to resourcing that sees us permanently resource to a level below our peak business demand and then use flexible resourcing (including temps/FTA/interims) for time limited periods to address the gaps etc. This is important context and a deliberate part of the resourcing strategy.

AA/AO 
54 are Trainee 3 month or 18 month placements (starting with us from now till May 16) on our National Nature Reserves being funded by Heritage Lottery.  Remainder are temporary appointments  equired to work on local delivery plans and to  deliver against environment scheme targets,  with some  carrying out necessary  Wildlife Licensing work.

EO 
Temporary appointmentsShort Term and Fixed Term )  including extensions to work on local delivery plans. 
Include 3 Fixed Term Appointments for Strategic Access Management and Monitoring  (SAMM) project, to mitigate impacts of housing development on the Thames Basin Heaths special protected area. Funded by developer contributions. 

HEO 
12 are permanent posts required  to increase our ecologist skills to support frontline delivery of Protected Sites work. 1 additional post - Marine Monitoring Specialist.
Remainder are temporary appointments and extensions to support Local Delivery work in our Area Teams and the SAMM project.
